DeleteWorkspaceDialog.title: Delete a Workspace
DeleteWorkspaceDialog.introSection1: The below instructions will help you delete the workspace "{{workspaceName}}" from project namespace "{{projectNamespace}}" using kubectl.
DeleteWorkspaceDialog.introSection2: Remember that this action is <bold1>irreversible</bold1> and all resources within the workspace will be <bold2>permanently deleted</bold2>.
DeleteWorkspaceDialog.mainCommandDescription: Run this command to delete the workspace:
DeleteWorkspaceDialog.verificationCommandDescription: To verify the workspace has been deleted, run:

KubectlDeleteMcpDialog.title: Delete a Managed Control Plane
KubectlDeleteMcpDialog.introSection1: The below will help you delete the Managed Control Plane "{{mcpName}}" from workspace "{{workspaceNamespace}}" using kubectl.
KubectlDeleteMcpDialog.introSection2: Remember that this action is <bold1>irreversible</bold1> and all resources managed by this control plane will be <bold2>permanently deleted</bold2>.
KubectlDeleteMcpDialog.annotateCommand: First, annotate the ManagedControlPlane to confirm deletion:
KubectlDeleteMcpDialog.deleteCommand: Run this command to delete the Managed Control Plane:
KubectlDeleteMcpDialog.verificationCommandDescription: To verify the MCP has been deleted, run:

KubectlCreateProjectDialog.title: Create a Project
KubectlCreateProjectDialog.introSection: A Project is the starting point to our ManagedControlPlane offering. Projects are usually created for each Organization/Team or similar root setups.
KubectlCreateProjectDialog.mainCommandDescription: Run this command to create a new project:
KubectlCreateProjectDialog.resultCommandDescription: To see the result of the project creation, run the below command:
KubectlCreateProjectDialog.namespaceCommandDescription: A namespace is automatically generated for your project:

KubectlCreateWorkspaceDialog.title: Create a Workspace
KubectlCreateWorkspaceDialog.introSection: Let's add a Workspace to our Project. We use workspaces to separate productive and non-productive ManagedControlPlanes.
KubectlCreateWorkspaceDialog.mainCommandDescription: Run this command to create a new workspace in your project:
KubectlCreateWorkspaceDialog.resultCommandDescription: To see the result of the workspace creation, run the below command:

KubectlBaseDialog.prerequisitesText: Make sure you have installed <bold1>kubectl</bold1> and the <bold2>kubelogin</bold2> plugin. We recommend using <bold3>krew</bold3> which is a plugin manager for kubectl.
KubectlBaseDialog.formFieldsNote: <bold1>Important</bold1>: Before executing, modify the commands below:
KubectlBaseDialog.onboardingGuide: You can also use our <link1>Onboarding Guide</link1> for more information.

CommonKubectl.learnButton: Learn how to do this in code

validationErrors.properFormatting: Use A-Z, a-z, 0-9, hyphen (-), and period (.), but note that whitespace (spaces, tabs, etc.) is not allowed for proper compatibility.

validationErrors.atLeastOneUser: You need to have at least one member assigned.

createMCP.subtitleText: Your Managed Control Plane is being set up. It will be ready to use in just a few minutes. You can safely close this window.
